snippet: New York’s Attorney General’s office has weighed in on the possible sale of a Thomas Cole landscape that had long hung in the Seward House Historic Museum in upstate Auburn.
abstract: New York’s Attorney General’s office has weighed in on the possible sale of a Thomas Cole landscape that had long hung in the Seward House Historic Museum in upstate Auburn.

headline.main: Attorney General's Office Voices Concern About Sale of Hudson River School Painting
headline.print_headline: Oil Painting by Thomas Cole In New York Court Dispute
